translated: Praise to the Mother of Savior Buddha
Translated by the Abbot of Jingzhu Temple in Beijing, A Wang Zhashi
Homage to the Holy Mother of Savior Buddha.
All illnesses and offenses are healed by the savior, I respectfully praise and bow to the Mother of Salvation.ğŸ”½In the middle of the pure white lotus,
Upon which is spread a moon-disk seat,
Seated in the golden vajra cross-legged posture, I pay homage to the Mother of Vows.
Her face is like the autumn moon with a radiant appearance, the Buddha's body relies on the moon-disk,
All adornments are completely fulfilled, holding a blue lotus flower, I respectfully bow.
Her body and appearance are complete at the age of sixteen, the children of all perfectly enlightened ones,
Her superior body bestows according to one's wishes, I pay homage to the Holy Mother of Salvation.
The pure white light is white, the eight-spoked wheel displays the eight characters,
And has the appearance of universal rotation, I respectfully bow to the one with the wheel facing.
All buddha-lands are pure and clean, with many precious flowers spread throughout.
The mother who gives birth to the buddhas of the three times, to this honored mother I pay homage.
Holy mother, savior mother, mother who rescues and delivers, mother who increases life, wish-fulfilling wheel,
In front of the honored mother, I pray with courage, to dispel the demons that shorten our lifespans.
In sickness and all kinds of difficulties, I rely on your ability to pray for protection.
For all the excellent and ordinary accomplishments, grant them all to me without remainder.
Those who sincerely respect the honored mother, she always remembers them like a child.
In front of the honored one, I also offer prayers, only requesting that you always hold the hook of compassion.
The mother's supreme body is like the color of the moon, slender and gentle, with an upright form.
Adorned with precious ornaments and fine silk for a skirt,
On a jeweled seat in the lotus moon disc, sitting in the full vajra posture with two feet,
One face, two arms, with a joyful countenance, the mother of the Buddhas of the three times
Always kneeling before the honored mother, now in front of the honored one with slight praise
For the sake of our cultivation of the Way, from now until enlightenment
Eliminating all adverse conditions in between, may we attain abundant favorable conditions
